column4: Why should a dual-booter do a "proper" ubuntu installation instead of through wubi? In other words, how is a "proper" installation better (for both, the user and ubuntu community/canonical)? Please help.

allows proper managment of paritions as a whole, if the windows partition is corrupted you may still boot into ubuntu, it's faster (though less noticable on newer pcs, those on fast SATA and SSDs won't notice much)
